answers.author: Jose Machicao
answers.text:
You have to start approving a Project Management Methodology with all key leaders for all projects. This methodology should involve at least:
- A kick off meeting with all key stakeholders (those decision makers who are going to authorize work and priority in those departments involved in the project).
- A Project Charter signed by all stakeholders. In order to approve the project charter, please always use a benefit/cost chart for all stakeholder, to let them know what the benefits and costs are for all of them because of the project. They all have to sign.
- Never start planning activities, always deliverables or final product components of the project. Never make the commitments about activities, do it about deliverables (achievements).
- Use risk management techniques, related to deliverables.
I hope you find these advices useful
Regards
Jose Machicao (Peru)

answers.author: Sylvia Carrillo
answers.text:
I agree with Jose. The City of Corpus Christi uses a Project Management methodology. We hold an early assistance meeting with a team of staff who have generally received the information a week or so in advance so that they may come to the meeting well prepared. Those staff who have comments come to the meeting. It's a one shot system where if the staff missed something due to lack of preparation, etc on our part, then we dont get a second opportunity to play "gotcha". A project manager runs the meeting and gathers pertinent data. If there  is any followup, they do that as well. Their job is to act as a liason with the developer/builder and keep everyone in the communication loop. This prevents major issues from arising. The PM is the staff "leader" and as such can call whatever staff from whatever department to the meeting. If there is an issue, they take it up the command chain thru an issue resolution process. We have rarely had to use such tactics as most staff work well together. Our customers love it. I can put you in contact with the consultant who helped us craft the "process improvements". He was instrumental in making the shift to a new way of doing business.

answers.text:
The City of Wilsonville, Oregon developed a Community Solutions Team that is made up of representatives of each department.    The team meets monthly to review projects and programs that impact multiple departments or the city as a whole.   Each topic brought to the team is given a ranking of its requirment for followup - such as:   FYI report only, 
place on city master calendar, discussion and team recommendation, assign a specific task group for further study, refer to a citizen board or commission,  etc.    In this way, each representative is required to be alert to the concerns of their constituents and step up to address issues that they have questions or resources for.
This method has caught important glitches, addressed items of common concern all at one time, and brought the departments of the city in better alignment with one another.
Good luck,
peggy watters, community services director

answers.author: Dele Smith
answers.text:
I agree with Jose. Fulton County uses numerous cross-functional teams and for complex or longer-term engagements, I recommend having a charter and defined roles (based on project management methodology). The key for making it successful is ensuring that the sponsor actively supports the project team (no competing priorities, reasonable deadlines, providing necessary resources, etc.)  and that the bosses/departments of each project team member support their involvement.
I've attached the project roles/responsibilities form I developed for this purpose as well as a team charter we currently use (which can be adapted for a project team).  Many of your questions are addressed by these documents. Good luck!

The City of Richmond is interested in guidelines or procedures addressing how projects for which multiple departments have roles and responsibilities are organized and administered. For instance, how do you:
o   Designate ultimate responsibility for the projects(s)?
o   Keep all players involved and informed 
o   Ensure that all required actions are identified and acted upon
o   Identify all contingencies
o   Maintain quality control
Thanks!
title: Cross-department projects
